modules.description: Converts a string representation of a log threshold into an internal representation, supporting parsing of log level values. Works with string inputs and log threshold types used in logging configurations. Used to configure log verbosity dynamically via command-line arguments.

Converts IPv4 and IPv6 addresses and prefixes from string representations into corresponding Ipaddr types. Handles both specific address formats and network prefixes. Used to parse command-line arguments for IP-related configurations.

Provides functions to define IPv4 networks with prefixes and optional gateway addresses, using `Ipaddr.V4.Prefix.t` and `Ipaddr.V4.t` types. Constructs command-line terms for network configuration and gateway settings, tailored for use with Mirage runtime documentation. Enables precise control over IP address ranges and default routing in network setups.

Provides functions to define IPv6 network configurations, set a default gateway, and control acceptance of router advertisements. Works with IPv6 address prefixes, individual IPv6 addresses, and boolean flags. Used to configure network interfaces in command-line tools with specific routing and addressing parameters.

Provides functions to generate, configure, and deploy unikernels targeting Xen, KVM, and BHyve, including building standalone network applications. Works with configuration files, build scripts, and platform-specific metadata to customize deployment. Used to automate the creation of lightweight, secure network services for cloud and embedded environments.

Registers Cmdliner terms as runtime arguments and provides a callback to access their parsed values. Processes command-line arguments with custom sections for man pages and handles exit codes for errors, help, and version flags. Works with Cmdliner.Term.t to structure and evaluate command-line input.

Converts string-based log thresholds into internal log level representations, enabling dynamic log configuration through command-line inputs. Supports parsing of log level values such as "debug," "info," and "error" into corresponding type-safe representations. Provides functions to map string inputs to log threshold types used in runtime configurations. Allows developers to adjust logging verbosity at runtime without hardcoding values.

Parses and constructs network configurations using IP address types, enabling precise control over IPv4 and IPv6 settings. Supports creation of network prefixes, gateway definitions, and router advertisement policies through specialized data structures. Converts string inputs into structured IP representations for use in command-line argument parsing. Allows setting up complete network interfaces with defined address ranges, default routes, and IPv6 configuration options.
